national_indicator_description: Maternal mortality rate is defined as the number of women's death due to pregnancy in specified time period, regardless of its duration, which occurred during the period of pregnancy itself or within 42 days after its termination, from any cause related to or aggravated by the pregnancy or its course (except for accidents or other incidental reasons).
computation_definitions: The ratio defines the three-year average of maternal mortality level.
computation_calculations: The indicator is calculated as а ratio of recorded maternal deaths over the last three years, per 100 000 live births over the same time period.
comments_limitations: Source: Records of Civil status Acts on deaths.
